				[1749] link 'Reviews (12)', url='http://127.0.0.1:7770/bushnell-743333-boresighter-with-case-arbors-black.html#reviews'
					StaticText '('
					StaticText '12'
					StaticText ')'
			[1751] tabpanel 'Reviews (12)'
				[1895] strong ''
					StaticText 'Customer Reviews'
				[1921] list ''
					[1922] listitem ''
						StaticText 'Good for some, but not all'
						[1924] LayoutTable ''
							[1925] LayoutTableRow ''
								[1926] LayoutTableCell 'Rating'
									StaticText 'Rating'
								StaticText '\ue605\ue605\ue605\ue605\ue605'
								StaticText '\ue605\ue605\ue605\ue605\ue605'
								StaticText '60%'
						StaticText "First off, the bore sighter itself seems well built and straight forward. Locks in place and has a decent image to help get you on paper. That's my understanding of it. However, this did not work for my AR-15, Colt 22LR., or my Mosin Nagant. Only get this if you have a scope close to your barrel, very low profile. Perhaps for hunting rifles and such it'll be fine, but for an AR and others you might want to just get a laser sighter instead."
						[1937] paragraph ''
							StaticText 'Review by'
							[1939] strong ''
								StaticText 'Nicholas Cornell'
						[1940] paragraph ''
							StaticText 'Posted on'
							[1942] time ''
								StaticText '4/19/23'
					[1943] listitem ''
						StaticText 'Optic bore sighter that can be used in limited space. Only with Standard rifle and scope mount'
						[1945] LayoutTable ''
							[1946] LayoutTableRow ''
								[1947] LayoutTableCell 'Rating'
									StaticText 'Rating'
								StaticText '\ue605\ue605\ue605\ue605\ue605'
								StaticText '\ue605\ue605\ue605\ue605\ue605'
								StaticText '80%'
						StaticText 'This is an optic bore sighter, that will set a standard rifle and scope to 100 yards at the kitchen table. I did not have a range available with a 100 yd distance, Nor one right now with 25 yards, so I needed something that would work optically, rather than laser. The sighter has a crystalline glass plate with a 100 yard set target alignment etched into it. It will work for a rifle with a scope rise of 1.5 inches which does limit it. Measurement is from center of scope to enter of bore. It will not work for ARs or AKs or any rifle that has a scope more than 1.5 inches above the bore, which greatly limits it. Could be improved it it had a way of using it with elevated scopes.Designed primarily for standard rifle and scope sets.'
						[1958] paragraph ''
							StaticText 'Review by'
							[1960] strong ''
								StaticText 'Nathine Goldenthal'
						[1961] paragraph ''
							StaticText 'Posted on'
							[1963] time ''
								StaticText '4/19/23'
					[1964] listitem ''
						StaticText 'Indispensable, easy to use.'
						[1966] LayoutTable ''
							[1967] LayoutTableRow ''
								[1968] LayoutTableCell 'Rating'
									StaticText 'Rating'
								StaticText '\ue605\ue605\ue605\ue605\ue605'
								StaticText '\ue605\ue605\ue605\ue605\ue605'
								StaticText '100%'
						StaticText "Great sighter. Good thing I picked this up before the deer season.Super easy to use, took just a quick glance over the instructions, attached to my rifle, adjusted it a bit, and voila, done. Took less than 5 minutes to attach and adjust my first time, significantly quicker than that on subsequent guns.Turned out my rifle was dead on, I've just turned into a crappy shot after about 10 years away from hunting.However, it ended up being the perfect thing for both my father and brother-in-law, whose scopes were so far off, they both really needed the tuning of this, they would have wasted well over 10 rounds getting dialed in without it. Brother-in-law had sighted his in before the elk hunt, and assumed he was still good. Unfortunately, he missed a shot pretty severely and double-checked his scope with this sighter, and got dialed back in, and tagged a buck a few days later."
						[1979] paragraph ''
							StaticText 'Review by'
							[1981] strong ''
								StaticText 'Silvanus'
						[1982] paragraph ''
							StaticText 'Posted on'
							[1984] time ''
								StaticText '4/19/23'
					[1985] listitem ''
						StaticText 'Check all parts asap when you revive them so can replace any that are bad !'
						[1987] LayoutTable ''
							[1988] LayoutTableRow ''
								[1989] LayoutTableCell 'Rating'
									StaticText 'Rating'
								StaticText '\ue605\ue605\ue605\ue605\ue605'
								StaticText '\ue605\ue605\ue605\ue605\ue605'
								StaticText '60%'
						StaticText "Ordered this February of 2019 didn’t get a chance to use the .22/.27adjustable arbor wanted to sight in a new AR well a friend and i could not slid the arbor into the barrel of the AR my friend brought his kit over just for kicks, his arbor same arbor (Bushnell) his worked. With a little investigation we found the issue someone somewhere had tightened the arbor to tight and bent the fingers out past the ID of a 22 barrel don't think I will use it will have to order a new arbor!"
						[2000] paragraph ''
							StaticText 'Review by'
							[2002] strong ''
								StaticText 'DLG'
						[2003] paragraph ''
							StaticText 'Posted on'
							[2005] time ''
								StaticText '4/19/23'
					[2006] listitem ''
						StaticText 'Not for iron sights'
						[2008] LayoutTable ''
							[2009] LayoutTableRow ''
								[2010] LayoutTableCell 'Rating'
									StaticText 'Rating'
								StaticText '\ue605\ue605\ue605\ue605\ue605'
								StaticText '\ue605\ue605\ue605\ue605\ue605'
								StaticText '20%'
						StaticText 'First of all, writing the review, it asked me to rate warmth? WTF? Product is only good for scopes, forget iron sights. Terrible manual, website is no better. Might work good for scoops, I do not know, I returned it. Good quality from the looks of it.'
						[2021] paragraph ''
							StaticText 'Review by'
							[2023] strong ''
								StaticText 'scott andrews'
						[2024] paragraph ''
							StaticText 'Posted on'
							[2026] time ''
								StaticText '4/19/23'
					[2027] listitem ''
						StaticText 'Pretty good boresighter'
						[2029] LayoutTable ''
							[2030] LayoutTableRow ''
								[2031] LayoutTableCell 'Rating'
									StaticText 'Rating'
								StaticText '\ue605\ue605\ue605\ue605\ue605'
								StaticText '\ue605\ue605\ue605\ue605\ue605'
								StaticText '80%'
						StaticText 'This boresighter works pretty good, if you put the scope right on center with a 22Lr or equivalent youll be almost centered, I used it on my sks and the the sights have to be just a hair above center line to hit a 6 inch circle at 100 yards, I also used it on 3 mosins, one of them with a scope, I had to put the scope 4 squares above center to hit target, the other 2 mosins have iron sights and those got set at 2 above and the other one at 3 above. Its a little tricky to use at 1st, but it works, and its fairly good for getting on paper, I used it at the range, which was nice to help get on paper 1st.... when I sighted in scoped mosin on center line it hit high at 100 yards, (like 14 inches) so I went 2 squares up from center at first, then shot, still high but better, then went 4 squares above, and made 6 shots in 6 inch circle at 100 yards, the rifle was rested with sand bags and I barely touched the gun to fire, just to pull trigger and just having my shoulder against it. I am happy with it, when using it just dont let it shift around in bore., the arbors work ,but still be careful, It will not work on any raised scope like a AR 15 or M4 so keep that in mind My thoughts is if its a high powered round go up from center 1st, if above you shoot low if under center you shoot high,, for me center line only worked on my 22 lr rifle, bring it with you to the range and get on paper. vertically I had no issues with left or right with my rifles......kinda wierd'
						[2042] paragraph ''
							StaticText 'Review by'
							[2044] strong ''
								StaticText 'Matthew bass player'
						[2045] paragraph ''
							StaticText 'Posted on'
							[2047] time ''
								StaticText '4/19/23'
					[2048] listitem ''
						StaticText 'Claims are very misleading!'
						[2050] LayoutTable ''
							[2051] LayoutTableRow ''
								[2052] LayoutTableCell 'Rating'
									StaticText 'Rating'
								StaticText '\ue605\ue605\ue605\ue605\ue605'
								StaticText '\ue605\ue605\ue605\ue605\ue605'
								StaticText '20%'
						StaticText 'I set my rifle up using the Bushnell Professional Bore Sighter. Using a bench vice, the first shot did not put me on paper at 50 yards. I had a 20" x 20" target and missed by a mile. Luckily I hit the backstop. 8" low from center and to the right 18". Bushnell claims it will put sighting-in test shots "on the paper". I had similar results using different guns. I Would Not recommend this product.'
						[2063] paragraph ''
							StaticText 'Review by'
							[2065] strong ''
								StaticText 'Pamela Birchenough'
						[2066] paragraph ''
							StaticText 'Posted on'
							[2068] time ''
								StaticText '4/19/23'
					[2069] listitem ''
						StaticText 'Zeroing in'
						[2071] LayoutTable ''
							[2072] LayoutTableRow ''
								[2073] LayoutTableCell 'Rating'
									StaticText 'Rating'
								StaticText '\ue605\ue605\ue605\ue605\ue605'
								StaticText '\ue605\ue605\ue605\ue605\ue605'
								StaticText '80%'
						StaticText "Watched a retired lifetime gunsmith use one to boresight a rifle/scope project of mine -- a semi-auto which could not be boresighted the traditional way. Sure enough, he got me very close at 100 yards. I researched it, the price was reasonable, and so I bought one for myself. What truly surprised me was that my brand new one seems to be right there in quality comparison with the smiths 20+ year old unit. Nice case, decently built, the biggest difference being that -- despite what the product photo depicts above -- the cases now come with a weird magnetic latching system for the flap. Seems cheesy, but works well.....so far. My biggest squawk? It isn't very close to true zero, but at least it is consistent. Once I figured out that it would always put the first shot three inches high and two left, I could adjust the scopes reticles against the internal collimating grid to compensate and get a near-bullseye on the first shot thereafter. This will definitely get you close to zero at 100 yards on your first shot thus saving precious ammo at the range the next day. I also own a laser type boresighter and this Bushnell seems to be a better choice. The lasers are all so stinking dim that they can only be used outdoors at dusk and at very close ranges, whereas this Bushnell unit can be used indoors from the comfort of your own living room and no scrambling for oddball batteries at the last minute."
						[2084] paragraph ''
							StaticText 'Review by'
							[2086] strong ''
								StaticText 'Rick Money'
						[2087] paragraph ''
							StaticText 'Posted on'
							[2089] time ''
								StaticText '4/19/23'
					[2090] listitem ''
						StaticText 'M1A bore sighting'
						[2092] LayoutTable ''
							[2093] LayoutTableRow ''
								[2094] LayoutTableCell 'Rating'
									StaticText 'Rating'
								StaticText '\ue605\ue605\ue605\ue605\ue605'
								StaticText '\ue605\ue605\ue605\ue605\ue605'
								StaticText '100%'
						StaticText 'Initially tried to use the BoreSighter on a M1A rifle with Springfield flash hider but could not obtain consistent results using the included arbor in the flash hider. I then tried a Springfield flash suppressor alignment gauge as a mount for the Boresighter. I placed a small O ring over the shaft of the gauge up against the handle. Placed the gauge in the barrel with the handle against the flash hider, the O ring compressed in the mouth of the flash hider preventing the gauge from rotating. I was then able to easily bore sight the rifle, and duplicate the results several times. The result of the bore sighting placed the shots near the bullseye for an easy zero.'
						[2105] paragraph ''
							StaticText 'Review by'
							[2107] strong ''
								StaticText 'Whispertools'
						[2108] paragraph ''
							StaticText 'Posted on'
							[2110] time ''
								StaticText '4/19/23'
					[2111] listitem ''
						StaticText 'Easy to use, and works like a charm.'
						[2113] LayoutTable ''
							[2114] LayoutTableRow ''
								[2115] LayoutTableCell 'Rating'
									StaticText 'Rating'
								StaticText '\ue605\ue605\ue605\ue605\ue605'
								StaticText '\ue605\ue605\ue605\ue605\ue605'
								StaticText '100%'
						StaticText 'I was kinda skeptical, and didn\'t know what to expect when I ordered this. But, boy, am I glad I did. I had a rifle that I had just put a new variable power scope on. It really needed to be bore sighted. I verified that the scope was level to the rifle, grabbed the correct insert, and put it in the sighting scope, and placed it in the barrel. Using a lead sled to keep the rifle steady, it\'s just a matter of putting the scope cross hairs on the center of the little target you see in the boresight. Easy. So, took the rifle out to zero it today. WOW! I am impressed. Dead on left to right, and only about 5 inches high. A few clicks, to adjust the height, and couple more rounds to verify, and it was dead on. The cost saving on "shooting around" to find the zero amazing. Total of 8 rounds fired and gun is dead on. I would recommend this tool.'
						[2126] paragraph ''
							StaticText 'Review by'
							[2128] strong ''
								StaticText 'LL Dude'
						[2129] paragraph ''
							StaticText 'Posted on'
							[2131] time ''
								StaticText '4/19/23'
				[2135] strong ''
					StaticText 'Page'
				[2136] list 'Page'

						[2138] strong ''
							StaticText "You're currently reading page"

step_data.thought:
I can now see I'm in the reviews section of the page. Looking at the accessibility tree, elements [1921] to [2131] contain the customer reviews for the Bushnell 743333 Boresighter. I can see that:

1. The product has a 68% rating out of 100 (shown in element [1554])
2. There are 12 reviews total (shown in elements [1565] and [2137-2146] which indicate I'm on page 1 with a page 2 available)
3. The reviews show various ratings from 20% to 100%
4. The reviews provide detailed feedback about the product's performance

I can see reviews from multiple customers with different experiences:
- Some gave it 100% ratings, saying it works well for standard rifles
- Others gave lower ratings (20-60%) noting limitations with certain firearms like AR-15s
- Several reviewers mentioned it's easy to use once you understand how it works
- Some reviewers had issues with specific parts or compatibility
